website_summaries.verdict: An attractive model for those who want an alternative lantern light source and don't need bright light.
pros: Produces soft, reliable light with three spring-loaded candles that last up to 9 hours
Effective for outdoor and indoor use
cons: The unit gets a bit warm during use and the light output isn't as bright as others we reviewed

customer_reviews.title: Safety Hazard
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy review and I dont do many. If company responds I will change depending on outcome. Very, very unsafe. Candles dont feed properly and leaks wax everywhere. And photos for it to include a finger now covered in silvadene. I'm an idiot, so I've been testing all 3 UCO 3 candle chandeliers and 2 singles. Singles are fine for now. But waiting on adding a new candle before review. Chandeliers are 0 for 3. At least one candle doesn't burn properly and oozes wax everywhere. Failure........ look at what dripped on the sink. Yes testing over a sink if that tells you anything....
customer_reviews.author: J H

customer_reviews.title: Great investment and a great backup if you find yourself ...
customer_reviews.text: I was totally excited and anxy to use this lattern when it got home. Last night I lit the candles at 7:00 pm and this morning at 7 am one candle burned out, the other two burned out about an hour from each other after 7 pm. I tucked a blanket underneath the bedroom door and through the night the room was decently warm enough to avoid turning on the furnace. Great investment and a great backup if you find yourself suddently homeless, living in your car and needing warmth.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have if you're a van dweller, prepper, or camper
customer_reviews.text: This lantern is amazing at heating up a van or vehicle when car camping. It won't keep you warm if the temps are below 40 degrees F, but it definitely takes the chill out of the air on cool nights. The top gets hot enough to boil water for tea, so yeah - it puts out some heat. The candles are expensive, but there are YouTube hacks for making your own. Easier and cheaper to buy them unless you use it daily tho. No odor, no smoke, just light, and heat. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Blanton

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Impressive candle lantern, puts out a lot of heat I was able to boil 1 cup of water in about 30 min, and when coupled with a Seebeck Effect fan, this makes a great tent heating option for the winter I wasn't sure a Seebeck Effect fan would work, but this lantern has no problem running the fan at full speed, you can even hear the wind noise from the fan in the video
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Multi uses
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! I got it for a recent camping trip just for warmth and light. However, several windy nights and damp fire pits led to me using to heat food on. I was impressed that it could heat chili, soup, and water all on the three candles. Not to mention it could hang in my tent and warm it up. I couldn't recommend it more!
customer_reviews.author: Mary rogers

customer_reviews.title: Not a reliable product.
customer_reviews.text: Received the lantern and the top part was crooked and the hole holding the steel part wasn’t even open. I contacted the manufacturer to no avail. So much for a warranty.
customer_reviews.author: sandee

customer_reviews.title: Safe, Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize that the lantern had a metal plate on top for heating food, etc. It has a long handle, which I like. The candles are secure inside the metal holders so they do not tilt or fall. The springs inside the metal holders keep the candles pushed up to the top, and there is a viewing window to see how much of the candles are left. The lantern seems to be of good quality. I hesitated on spending the money because it seems pricey, but I'm glad that I finally did. After seeing it in person, I feel much better about the safety of the lantern [cats, children knocking it over].
customer_reviews.author: K. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome buy
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this thing. I started out with the smaller compact one that broke. So I wanted to upgrade and this thing was on sale. It is a bulky thing to carry around but when I'm ultra lite camping I have the extra space and use it to carry this thing. I bought the citronella candles for it and it really helped with the bugs too.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Clever design, works as it should!
customer_reviews.text: So far I love it! Only used it once so far but it seems durable, the candle wax didn’t get messy and it really did let out a little heat. We had a cup of water boiling in 20 minutes or less. The top part where you put your mug gets really hot in an instant. But the aluminum base stays cool. Gave off a really nice warm light around the picnic table. Definitely no buyer’s remorse here. Bought primarily for camping and power outages.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More than just a light source.
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these years ago, but someone else decided they needed it more. This candle lantern can also be used as a heat source for making cup of tea of anything warm and can keep a three person expedition tent comfy warm if doing any winter mountaineering. Well worth the money just be careful you don't break the glass.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Find a different solution. Not a very good system. Stay away.
customer_reviews.text: Well it’s a great concept, but in practice it doesn’t work very well. On my first attempt to run it, one of the candles melted down in the wax flowed out the bottom. I called UCO three times and left messages for people no one has gotten back to me. I also emailed their customer support ONLINE and I’ve gotten zero response. I’m in a customer service heavy business and if I conducted myself this way I’d be out of a job. Very disappointed both in the product and in their lack of customer support.
customer_reviews.author: Ken O.

customer_reviews.title: Good concept, but design needs tweaking
customer_reviews.text: Same as the single lantern design, this one is simpler to use with the lack of multiple pieces and can even be used as a cook source. However, as in the design of the single lantern the wax falls out the sides when moved around and creates a mess. when the end of the candle is reached you must use a knife (or something) to punch out the old one and scrape off the old wax before inserting a new one. Time consuming and impractical for hiking or failing camping use but convenient for backyard or indoor rustic lighting periodically.
customer_reviews.author: HK_MarineActual

customer_reviews.title: Great light output...not so much heat.
customer_reviews.text: Used this in our small camper and it produced minimal heat. Good light output though. Would guess it’s actual BTU output is much lower than what it’s rated at. Never boiled water on it but I believe w direct contact it could boil a small cup/bowl of water. If you’re expecting to stay warm, I wouldn’t use this in anything other than emergency situations in your vehicle, or in a small tent in above freezing temps.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Classic favorite for a reason!
customer_reviews.text: Love these, weve had the single and the triple for years. I’m a bit of a collector of good flashlights and camp lights (battery and solar-powered, and only this for flame). Batteries die, the sun may not shine and solar tech is still a little iffy - and neither will warm a small area as one of these will in a pinch, always great for car camping, plus they are lovely when used outside to create ambience. Great quality, candles are great
customer_reviews.author: Splitrock River

customer_reviews.title: Faulty spring, melting wax everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: 1 of 3 candles had a faulty spring; candle basically melted inside the aluminum sleeve, sending wax everywhere. Unable to adjust (faulty) spring; have contacted manufacturer to report defect, and to report safety issue regarding this lantern.
customer_reviews.author: Jha31

customer_reviews.title: Broken on arrival
customer_reviews.text: I guess I can't really blame the maker of this lantern as it was shipped by Amazon, but it literally just arrived and out of the box, the globe was broken and could see a spring had popped, and upon opening up lantern base where spring loads into is cracked, which is why won't hold metal sleeve and candle in place. Very disappointed as I was looking forward to useing it camping this weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Tmac

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for emergencies
customer_reviews.text: Works great, has a glass globe so wind won't blow it out, and spring loaded candles. I bought beeswax ones for replacements. They last longer and have a pleasant, subtle scent, and are 100% natural. I keep two of these on hand for emergencies, plus a couple of oil lamps so I am always prepared for power outages. They complement each other nicely, and with a few votive candles for the bathrooms, I am ready to power out. I haven't used these for camping, but think they would be all right for inside the tent, but not bright enough for outside at a picnic table.
customer_reviews.author: Applewhite MinyardTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Warmth for winter camping
customer_reviews.text: Like the red color, dislike flimsy heat shield Saw a video on YouTube, Uco candleier by Prius stealth camper to convert to oil candles more heat longer run time cheaper. I use 2 lanterns 4 oil candles each to heat the interior of my 95 jeep zj winter camping, lowest o-side temp 28 degrees i-side temp 86 degrees heat 6-7 hrs. Amazon Must have!!!!!! Buys kidde C-O monitor for safety Voda heat activated fan, and of course a FIRE EXT. Within arms reach tested snoq. Pass, fs. 70 road greenwater Wa. Unreal warmth for camping,with out running vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Kitcheninja

customer_reviews.title: Nice but a bit high priced.
customer_reviews.text: Have not used yet took and tried at home worked nice. So I purchase more candles. White and blue. I was very surprised to see how little it was for the amount of money you pay for it. I believe the reflection piece should come with it or at less the price should be less.
customer_reviews.author: jacjlinda

customer_reviews.title: Boils water!
customer_reviews.text: A lot of reviews say this warms water. Well, it does more than that. It boils water. Today I filled a metal measuring cup with one cup of water and covered it with aluminum foil. In 16 minutes, it was simmering. In 17 minutes it was boiling. In 18 minutes, I had a full-on rolling boil. This device is painfully expensive but there is nothing else quite like it. I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Patience Carter

customer_reviews.title: Fast Service
customer_reviews.text: This was an experiment for me and it worked. Woke up about 2 or 3 in the morning in my tent and Lit the candles and by morning the temp had risen, I guess, about 10 to 15 degees. A noticeable difference. The second night the candles did not burn evenly and wax ran into the lantern but I still had good results. Would recommend but only for a small two-person tent.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wolfensparger

customer_reviews.title: Great quality & function!
customer_reviews.text: I love this lantern! Burns 12-hour beeswax candles perfectly & provides lots of warmth on the little heat shield to warm up a beverage or even cook a little food. I only burned one out of the three candles in the lantern & that heat shield was HOT!! If all three candles were burning, you could easily cook on that little “stove top.” It’s safe & functional whether you’re burning one, two or all three of the candles. I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Broken. But good product.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived broken, amazon sent a replacement which arrived quickly but was ALSO BROKEN! Having said that it is a great product. The candles are a little pricy but better when you buy bulk!
customer_reviews.author: Craig M.

customer_reviews.title: Great product love it!
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as expected. Makes candles last longer then if used alone. I am just not sure how long it will last if used frequently. The spring assembly inside and the way the spring attaches seems like it may not hold up to heavy use. But if you are buying this for emergencies or camping and expect to only need a few time a year at most then its perfect! It will last many many years that way.
customer_reviews.author: Ripper

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but has some big flaws
customer_reviews.text: I tested this product before relying on it and I am glad. It malfunctioned and got melted wax on the table and inside the housing . It was difficult to clean the wax from the unit . I do not recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Leonard

customer_reviews.title: I didn't like it, the lady I gave it to loves it,  5 Stars from her.
customer_reviews.text: Too much light to sleep by attempting to use it as a heater in my small motorhome. The candles didn't last all night so it went out leaving me to wake up from the cold. It is a great lantern though. The lady I gave it to uses it to heat her van, and she is thrilled. What woman wouldn't like a candle lantern?
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great Emergency Heat for Winter Automobile Break Downs
customer_reviews.text: I love these candliers. I keep one in each of our cars and 2 in our vans. The neoprene cocoon is a perfect match, as it keeps the candliers safe, even if they roll out and drop onto the blacktop or concrete (order separately). I also give these sets for house warming gifts to those new to our cold harsh winters. I would not part wit a single one of them.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Wildly Overpriced Candleholder
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product with the hopes of it producing some level of heat and the expectation that it would put off a significant amount of light. The let down on the heat portion of it wasn't too disappointing. I attempted to heat water up on it for the sake of testing it's ability to do so, it really didn't do much in that regard. In terms of the lighting, it gives off the level of light you'd expect from 3 candles. At the price point, it would just make a lot more sense to rig up some candles in a jar. Not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: the best i have ever seen or owned i bought 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: the best i have ever seen or owned i bought 2 more got lucky got them for 16$ each i have about 100 9 hour candles that go in them so im set for a very long time and the white ones really last 9 hours....
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Just the right amount of light
customer_reviews.text: After numerous complaints from my better half that my propane Coleman lantern was too bright, I went hunting for an alternative for on the camp table. I've used this a half dozen times now; it fits the bill perfectly and has been a huge hit. The only trouble so far is that camping along the Deschutes during a caddis hatch led to enough bug carcasses that the flames were occasionally doused. Could probably be fixed with some fine steel mesh at the top.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: This Lantern is simple just like any lantern, with 3 candles it has enough light to let you see in the dark. The best thing about this product is in the e-world, this require no power, battery, and you will not feel it is messy or anything. The Candle burn very clean. The added benefit is you can use this Lantern to cook. The springs keep your frame always at the same position which is great for boil the water and cooking. I will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: No batteries needed
customer_reviews.text: Works good in my square drop trailer to keep the chill off on cool nights. I like the fact it eliminates moisture buildup on the walls and ceiling. Just wish you had a oil conversion system to run lamp oil for 4 wicks as seen on you tube where a few fellas use glass whisky shot bottles hot glued together and put in place of the candles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wax was running all over the place. I think ...
customer_reviews.text: Wax was running all over the place. I think the heat was melting the candles. Because of that issue, it it only burned for maybe 4 hours. The clean up was a mess too.
customer_reviews.author: Cutty

customer_reviews.title: Great lantern with a minor design flaw, touhh easily corrected.
customer_reviews.text: This baby puts out a lot of heat. As a result, it sends to soften the candles to the point where they melt out the side or under the spring. the best way to prevent this is to not burn the candles from new to spent; burn them for a few hours at a time. that said, in cold weather, the lower ambient tempts help keep to prevent early melting as well. It's also been suggested that a fireproof insulation can be used to sleeve the candle housings, but I have no personal experience with that.
customer_reviews.author: Patrik D Taylor

customer_reviews.title: What a mess
customer_reviews.text: Used it last weekend and the first candle burned half way then leaked all over the floor of the tent. What a time cleaning the device so I can use that spot again! Hoping the beeswax candles work better, though I hear they don't produce as much light or heat...
customer_reviews.author: JohnyD56

customer_reviews.title: It simply works!
customer_reviews.text: There is beauty and an elegance to simple well engineered things that simply work. This lantern is no exception. Excellent quality. Easy to use. It puts out a very nice amount of light, and the heat it gives off is enough to warm up a small space, or a beverage. I love this lantern and will be buying a couple more in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Tumidgoose

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: This lantern should be in every preppers collection. Has a plate on top you can use to heat 15oz canned goods and also heats up a small room. Only drawback is when you need to change candles you have to scrape the un burnt wax from the bottom.....
customer_reviews.author: BITTERMAN

customer_reviews.title: great subtle light and use it to heat my teardrop ...
customer_reviews.text: great subtle light and use it to heat my teardrop trailer up in the fall and early spring.. DO NOT SLEEP with it on unless your window s are open..but perfect small heater
customer_reviews.author: R. R. McDonnell

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: Threw it away. It leaks candle wax all over from the bottom. It sticks the pieces so you can't reload. Had to scrape wax away too long. Threw it out.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.  Just perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Like the one-candle UCO lantern, this one is a much safer alternative to open candles used during a power outage or while camping. The only shortcoming is the requirement to use UCO candles - but it's worth it because they burn completely with no drip and virtually no soot. If you don't need the light of three candles, burn one at a time and get 27 hours of light before you have to replace the candles. A terrific product that's great for personal use or to give as a gift. Useful and Attractive.
customer_reviews.author: Agent 19

customer_reviews.title: Really like this one
customer_reviews.text: Really like this one... Reasonably compact for a 3 candle unit and with option to burn one, two or 3 candles... Haven't tried to heat a cup-o-water yet, but sure it good to keep a cup-o-coffee, coco warm ( good enough for me ). Perfect addition to the arsenal of of lighting / heating options...
customer_reviews.author: StevieW

customer_reviews.title: Great for emergency light and cooking
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to use and brighter than I expected. I didnt expect it to have a cooking platform. My only concern is the glass, while it is somewhat protected from breakage I'm not sure how it would react to a fall.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for an emergency
customer_reviews.text: We had a major storm last night and our power was out. I had to use my phone as a light to get to a flashlight. Then the little light in me head went on and remembered "The UCO lantern." What a cheery glow that gave for the next three hours until the power came on. I was so relieved to have this on hand. Thank you UCO.
customer_reviews.author: Reverand Cletus

customer_reviews.title: Well made, giving plenty of light. Long lasting candles, no wasted wax.
customer_reviews.text: This candle lantern is sturdy, and easy to use. Changing the candles can easily be done in the field. Almost nine hours of light from each candle. Twelve hours from the bee's wax refills.
customer_reviews.author: Jerl

customer_reviews.title: It's  dependable.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for ems dependable used it in harvy. Emilia storm very reliable great to know that you have light when you have to cut power for safety or when your batterie die helped to save my life TX
customer_reviews.author: Thomas nelsen

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Was doing some repairs on my house. Painted the whole interior and rather than get a hotel room for a night I just decided that I would sleep in the van. Are use the UCO Candle To keep me warm overnight worked great.
customer_reviews.author: paul marshal

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful product for your EMERGENCY KIT. Well made, and easy to use. The candles burn a total of 27 hours ( 9 hours each), and are sturdy enough not to melt in warmer climates. There is a spot on the top that can be used to warm a metal cup of water. I showed this to one of my Denver friends who stated this would be a perfect light/mini warmer for a "Winter Car EMERGENCY Kit". I purchased a total of 5. Love the product!
customer_reviews.author: Delyn Volmer

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after my sister got one and said it worked. Our lights went out ,due to a storm. I thought i would try to hat water on the top. I have an old corning wear tea pot I sat on the top. Within an hour the water was very hot. I would reconmend this great lantern to anyone for use in an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Matheny

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camping tool - beautiful warm lighting effect, warms the tent and I could heat water on top of it. It’s a bit expensive, but ingenious design and multifunctional camping item.
customer_reviews.author: GreenTea

customer_reviews.title: UCO Candle Lantern - Looks, Value and Usability
customer_reviews.text: UCO candle lanterns are really awesome. They are easy to use, noce looking, and there are a variety of candle types you can use with them. I have used the beewax, regular parafin and citronellas and all were great!
customer_reviews.author: Momzombie

customer_reviews.title: Works well, the 9 hour  candles are expensive
customer_reviews.text: The lantern works very well, easy to insert the candles, and the springs keep the candle at the correct level. The only issue I have, which has nothing to do with the function of the lantern (therefore the 5 stars), is the cost of the candles. Even if you bought the 20 pack, using 3 candles per night would cost you around $4. If you only use it occasionally for less than the 9 hour length per day, then it could be worth it, IMHO.
customer_reviews.author: GripandClip

customer_reviews.title: I love this candle lamp
customer_reviews.text: I love this candle lamp. It does get hot so be careful, but it keeps a nice flame. The cover is vented and had some luck actually keeping a flame going when outside. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Herron

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 Lamps, a waste of money. Claims to be 5000 btus, would not keep my coffee cup warm! Very hard to clean, wax melts inside lamp, and part have sharp edges. You can get more light from a $5.00 Walmart lantern.
customer_reviews.author: butch maritato

customer_reviews.title: looks really cool when lite.
customer_reviews.text: I converted it to burn 4 oil bottles, I use firefly oil. burns awesome provides some heat. No soot or smoke. The candles for these are quite expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Moll

customer_reviews.title: Just get yourself a lantern and paraffin oil, or a large candle
customer_reviews.text: Only one candle burned properly without melting al over the place. Not worth the money. Just get yourself a lantern and paraffin oil, or a large candle. They'll last longer and wont make a mess.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Great lantern
customer_reviews.text: This lantern is a great product for Hurricane preparedness. Not only do you have the option of the amount of light that it puts out, by determining how many candles you light, but this can boil water, make coffee and even cook a meal on it. Very versatile. Buy more candles and you have a great back up multi tool for you home.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Messy
customer_reviews.text: Came with three candles and so far two of the candles melted down inside the spring chamber it created even more heat accelerating the melting process compounding the problem. Within minutes all three candles had melted down half way and filled the base with wax. Still have not used third candle but I Suspect the same will happen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for power outages
customer_reviews.text: Great for power outages but they create more heat that expected which can be a problem in the summer. When camping it's a much quieter source of light than propane. So late in the evening, propane is shut down and uco's come out.
customer_reviews.author: Zac

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed.
customer_reviews.text: This is a light duty lantern, you have to be moderately careful with it. However, it works great and the candles burn 9 or more hours. I work 12 hour shifts and was lighting them two or three hours after I got on site and never had it go out before my shift was over. It makes a good amount of light and produces a decent amount of heat.
customer_reviews.author: T. K. Sneed

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed a Bit
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in the size of the product for the money, works nicely but was expecting a product that’d deliver more than what it does.
customer_reviews.author: JLC

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting, BRIGHT lantern...
customer_reviews.text: Actually great for accessory HEAT for tent camping..( use CAUTION w/open flame) , Bright & long- burning lantern gets the job done the old-fashioned way..Love my UCO
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy2shoes

customer_reviews.title: Useful if you want to try candlelight in the evenings.
customer_reviews.text: Use it every night--great product! I found cleaning it in very hot water if I get wax buildup works better than putting it in a low-temperature oven.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Did what it needed to and more
customer_reviews.text: This product fulfilled all plus more of my needs puts out a lot of light, hangs easy with the bail handle and lasted quite a while didn't time it but lasted the major part of the three nights we used it camping and with the citronella candles I also bought on amazon got bug control too. Will be buying another for next year's outings and power loss times
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Awesome light for lights out.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great system for small spaces for heat and extra light. There should be a shield on the handle so you can carry it by the handle and not get burned.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Bright, bright, bright
customer_reviews.text: You really can make a cup of coffee or tea on this! Although I plan to tweak it for my own use, it throws off a lot of light, blindingly so! No complaints though.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma liz

customer_reviews.title: Convert to oil burners
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful lantern. I converted mine to oil burners. Oil burners are warmer, have an adjustable flame size, far Cheaper vs candles and will burn for around 14 hours plus depending on flame size. And it's a cleaner burn. Just make sure you get good indoor oil.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not very impressed.
customer_reviews.text: It is much smaller than appeared. And cheaply made for the price paid, The extra candles I bought are also too small !!#
customer_reviews.author: Hab Zog

customer_reviews.title: Poor packaging
customer_reviews.text: Delivered in a padded bag. Broken and bent. Returned. Did not appear to be made to last (metal was twisted and unrepairable)
customer_reviews.author: BD3

customer_reviews.title: This lamp is awesome! When I got home from work
customer_reviews.text: This lamp is awesome! When I got home from work, I had to unpack it and fire it up. I lit up all three candles and was very impressed with everything. The ease of use, amount of light, heat at the top and cool on the bottom and handle are all great. Even opening it up to check out/replace the candles is as simple as it can get and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Dw8man

customer_reviews.title: Old school remedy for EMP
customer_reviews.text: Just the thing when the lights go out. It puts out a little heat as well. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Drifter-99

customer_reviews.title: Pretty, function lantern
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made well thought out product. I want one in every color. Girls gotta have some pretty in her life, even in a disaster😏
customer_reviews.author: NJH

customer_reviews.title: Love the Candlelier.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the UCO Candleier. Light one, two, or all three candles for desired light and heat. Decent size, not too large. Keep one in my truck for emergencies, another in my RV for backup lighting and cooking if needed. Love the Candlelier. Suggest the Neoprene Cover for protection, have one for each Candelier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, but I wish it was a little bit ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, but I wish it was a little bit brighter. Maybe 1-2 more candles in this thing would be better. Also a bit pricey. Must be careful not to touch the metal top when lit or you will burn yourself.
customer_reviews.author: cwaters617

customer_reviews.title: Wow it’s amazing how much brighter this is than the UCO single ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow it’s amazing how much brighter this is than the UCO single candles that I’ve been using we’re going to use this car camping and I love the light that it puts off

product_meta.title: UCO Candlelier Deluxe Candle Lantern
product_meta.description: Need more lumens? Amp up the brightness and fend off chill with the UCO Candlelier Candle Lantern. Sporting three 9-hour candles, this brilliant source of heat and light is perfect for large groups of campers and for home and emergency use. Brighten up your next family picnic plus keep your coffee hot, too. Just place your mug or cooking pot on the heat shield and—voila! The Candlelier cleverly heats small amounts of water or food while providing a warm, ambient glow to your campsite or porch.
feature_bullets: Provides ample light, warms surroundings, and helps remove condensation.
Heats small amounts of water or food on heat shield.
Glass chimney and 3 spring-loaded candle tubes with viewing slots.
